metadata.Title: CVE-2015-7184 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The fetch API implementation in Mozilla Firefox before 41.0.2 does not restrict access to the HTTP response body in certain situations where user credentials are supplied but the CORS cross-origin request algorithm is improperly followed, which allows remote attackers to bypass the Same Origin Policy via a crafted web site.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7184` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 41.0.2+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 41.0.2+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 41.0.2+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 41.0.2+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '41.0.2+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
